column5: Very awesome report! A great effort must go into that trip.  Being up there at this time and catching and eating that fish, is revitalising for the soul.  Thanks for taking the time to post,  ehg
that's an amazing trip! i enjoyed reading the entire thing!  Thanks for sharing!
That was an awesome report.  The colours on those fish and of the meat are amazing.

Cookslav another one for the memory banks. Great work on the specks. You will be telling stories about that portage for years to come. If it ain't difficult you don't remember it. Two months from now those guys will be boasting to their buddies about the deadly portaging and the great fishing. You'll be able to chuckle to yourself as you remember them crying and whining on the trail.  Thanks  for sharing.  BTW what type of canoe did you have with you. Looks liek a Kevlar weave in the photos.  Nemo
Wow!! Fantastic report!  I suppose the only way it could have been better would be the weather, but hey, look at your results!  Congrats on an amazing trip....you are the hero now to the group....
Simply fantabulous  AWESOME report and pics.  Beautiful brookies. I've never seen flesh that red before.  I'm getting over stimulated!
Awesome report!

Absolutely...one report at a time LOL I think I'll Copy and paste this one Thanks for Photo compliment but I can't take all the credit, My brother was snapping shots as well....so I scammed a few of his as well, for the report.   Nemo...You sir would be correct! It was a beautifull ride last week! Nice and wide so it was quite stable to boot, really impressed with it.
Amazing report.  Wow, felft like I was there with y'all.  Thanks for sharing your adventure.  reefrunner
Great report , too bad about the *^%*&% weather!
Awesome fishing trip/report !!!!    great pics too....cheers
great report, thanks for sharing.
AWESOME!!  Just AWESOME!  Thanks for the report!

Cookslav, Thanks for taking the time to put that together.  Thoroughly amazing!! Glad you went from chump to hero.  I'm sure your family will be recounting this story for the rest of your life. Awesome fish and I was really taken by the colour of the meat!  And to have a chef on the trip!  It doesn't get much better than that. Thanks for taking me away from work for a little while.
Oh soo sweet... I'm leaving for Algonquin on Thursday..  I'm counting the minutes!!  Thanks!!  HD
AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!  RF
That's an excellent report.  Thank you.
Awesome report. One of my favorite places to visit and one of the biggest reasons to stay in Ontario and vacation here. You just can't beat what we have here in our own backyard.  Thanks  Mike
Great report cookslav.  Looks like a great spring trip.
not gonna lie...   a little jealous lol.   beauty report!
Thanks for the "journey" Cookslav! What a great family outing!!!
Excellent report, thank you

WOW! What a report! Now thats what I call really roughin it!!!! Glad to hear you had another successful fishing trip!  Must have took you over 2 hours to post it! Thanks for taking the time to share it.
A little? I am very jealous. Great Report
wonderful report, those sure were some beautiful fish.  congrats.  jason
Great Report!!!!
Thats a great read man, i love the lakes that are hard to get to.......always the best reading.  How many years have you had that hat?
great report and trip,thanks for sharing
Great report and beauty fish! Glad to see you had a good time!

An amazing report for sure.  Great to see a family getting out and sharing adventures like that (and luckily no one get left behind - after that snow many of my friends would have been sacrificed for suggesting the trip.  Thanks for sharing it.
Fantastic, what a fabulous report!
Man, what a report!  Thanks for the ride!
Nothing beats the colour of a Brook trout.  Awesome report!
Excellent report and pics!!!
Great report and pics! Thanks for sharing.

LOL Kyle...  Actually its a Brand new hat....although its identicle to my old one. My wife and I were just chuckling at that comment, so We went back and looked at all my fishing Pictures since 1997, and I'm wairing the Same fishing cap LOL!  I think I've actually had the same hat since 1995, but I just replaced it this year cause the old one had an unfortunate "battery Acid" incident.  Glad ya'll like my report, I miss the park already
Yup 1995....LOL
Cookslav, I remember your report from last year about this time as well.  Great post and report.  Wow !!
What a superb report.  I was there with you almost  Glad to year your run in with the moose turned out okay.  That could have been tragic.  Looking forward to next year's report now.  Joey

Cookslav, your post shows in spades what I love about that damn place, I got back today myself from five nights, and keep looking at the pictures I took.   You do a great job on the camera, I think.  Saturday and Sunday were a challenge with an inch of rain and 30 kt  breezes on the big lake Opeongo.  Buddy says that Algonquin is like an addiction, like gambling, because both will give you a cockeyed return on your investment.  Sometimes you lose, sometime you win, but when you win, it is the greatest thing going.  Solitude, wilderness, family and friends, challenges, successes and failures, too.  Thanks for the great effort it took to post such a great triplog.  I hope you can share with our friends on Algonquin Adventures.
... aboot those pics you took and keep looking at... we're waiting!

Speck-tacular ! Great pics and great report !  Thanks for sharing ... I am anxiously awaiting our annual opener in Quebec for the little square-tail beauties ... only another week to go a-la-Zec pour mois !

fantastic report man...thanks for sharing!  And that one photo in the morning mist....it's an award winner for sure! I am two long weeks away from heading up north, and now I don't think I'll be able to sleep tonight after reading that report
